name: UIExplorer

aliases.name: UI
aliases.comment: A UI represents a view and lists a set of stories

aliases.type: { id : String , description : String , viewStories : UIExplorer.UIViewConfig -> Html.Html UIExplorer.Msg }

types.name: UICategory
types.comment:
Represents a familly of related views.
For example using [Atomic Design](http://bradfrost.com/blog/post/atomic-web-design/), we can have the following categories : Atoms, Molecules etc..

values.name: addUICategory
values.comment: Add Category to a list of categories
values.type: String -> String -> String -> (UIExplorer.UIViewConfig -> Html.Html UIExplorer.Msg) -> List UIExplorer.UICategory -> List UIExplorer.UICategory

values.name: app
values.comment:
Launches a UIExplorer Applicaton given a list of categories
UICategoryType ( title, categories )
values.type: List UIExplorer.UICategory -> Platform.Program Basics.Never UIExplorer.Model UIExplorer.Msg

values.name: emptyUICategories
categoriesFromList
values.comment: Converts a list to a list of categories

values.name: renderStories
values.comment:
Renders Stories of a given UI.
A story represents a state of a view such as (Loading, Error, Success, NoNetwork ...)
values.type: (a -> Html.Html msg) -> List ( String, a ) -> UIExplorer.UIViewConfig -> Html.Html UIExplorer.Msg
